page.title: 06POULTRY FARM
page.content:
Walby'Fairholme" poultry farm. The poultry farm is really four gigantic sheds,two sections to each and housing 152,000 birds when full. The sheds that they keep the birds in are 200ft by 45ft.When they come in at a day old they put the tempereture to 90C. as they get older they put the tempereture down.
When the birds come in they are 1 day old and go out at 6.5 weeks. Usually several lorry loads are taken out each day 2,000 birds to a lorry. They are taken to the main factory in Carlisle and prepared for supermarkets all over the country.
The sheds are cleaned completly every 6 weeks by mechanical shovels. The chicken manure and sawdust is sold to farmers as fertiliser.
